01212MBT02-d-12-12-90-ATK.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
01212MBT02-d-12-12-90-ATK.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
01212MBT02-d-12-12-90-ATK.Narrative: ON DECEMBER 12, 1990, AMTRAK TRAIN #66 WAS PROCEEDING EAST ON TRK #2 APPROACHING BACK BAY STATION.TRAIN #66 CONSISTED OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES & 10 CARS WITH A CREW OF 5. UPON APPROACHING BACK BAY STATION THETRAIN DERAILED IN THE TUNNEL, CAUSING THE LOCOMOTIVES OF TRAIN #66 TO FOUL TRK #1 & COLLIDE WITH MBTA COMMUTER TRAIN #906. TRAIN 906 WAS MOVING IN AN EAST DIRECTION PREPARING TO STOP AT BACK BAY STATION. THE IMPACT CAUSED MASSIVE DAMAGE TO BOTH TRAIN SETS & A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF INJURIES. DUE TOTHE EXTENSIVENESS OF THE DAMAGE & INJURIES THE NTSB WAS NOTIFIED & INVOLVED IN THE SUBSEQUENT INVESTIGATION MINUTES AFTER IT OCCURRED. ALL CREW MEMBERS FROM BOTH TRAINS AND THE DISPATCHER INVOLVED WERE DRUG & ALCOHOL TESTED USING THE AUTHORITY GRANTED BY FRA POST ACCIDENT TESTING CRITERIA. ALL TESTRESULTS WERE RETURNED NEGATIVE. DUE TO THE MASSIVE DAMAGE SUSTAINED TO THE EQUIPMENT THE INVESTIGATION SURROUNDING THE CAUSE IS CONTINUING. THE EXTENT TO WHICH THE CREW MAY BE INVOLVED IS YET TO BE DETERMINED. UPON THE DEVELOPMENT OF FURTHER FACTS,....ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WILL BE PROVIDED TO UPDATE THIS REPORT.NoneNoneNone

122490C-d-12-25-90-ATK.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
122490C-d-12-25-90-ATK.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
122490C-d-12-25-90-ATK.Narrative: THE DIESEL SHOP SWITCH CREW WENT ON DUTY AT NEW HAVEN MOTOR STORAGE AT 9:30PM. THEIR FIRST MOVE WASGOING TO THE STATION TO GET THE METROLINER EQUIPMENT USED ON AMTRAK TRAIN 222. IN ORDER TO MAKE THEMOVE THE CREW USED AMTRAK ENGINE 326 & COUPLED ONTO SIX CARS. THE NEXT MOVE WAS TO BRING THE EQUIPMENT AROUND THE LOOP AND BACK INTO MOTOR STORAGE.THE CREW PULLED UP TRACK 14 HEADPINNING THE CLUB CAR20975 AND SET IT OFF ON TRACK #8 IN THE COACH YARD. THEY RETURNED TO TRACK 14 AND PICKED UP THE RESTOF THE TRAIN. PERMISSION WAS RECEIVED FROM METRO NORTH NEW HAVEN WEST OPERATOR TO PULL PAST THE SIGNAL. THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR D. MONAUS STOPPED THE TRAIN WHEN IT WAS EAST OF THE 8-14 SWITCH.HE THENINSTRUCTED ENGINEER E. SULLIVAN TO START SHOVING BACK. THE DERAILMENT COMMITTEE DETERMINED A PRELIMINARY CAUSE AS THE SWITCH THROWN UNDERNEATH MOVEMENT BY UNKNOWN PERSON OR CONDITION.AS OF THIS TIMEA FORMAL INVESTIGATION IS SCHEDULED TO DETERMINE THE CREWS RESPONSIBILITY, IF ANY CONCERNING THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT. A DRUG & ALCOHOL TEST FOR REASONALBLE CAUSE USING ATK AUTHORITY WAS PERFORMEDON ALL CREW MEMBERS WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.NoneNoneNone
